revised_title: Pure Cultures of Uredine Puccinia dispersa and Infection Experiments
tldr: The author conducted experiments to obtain pure cultures of the host plant, Bromus, and the rust fungus, Puccinia dispersa, by germinating seeds in antiseptic conditions. They discovered that the rust fungus could infect different species of Bromus under controlled conditions, and that the growth of pustules was excellent on some species. This research provides insights into the relationship between the host plant and the parasite.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Pathology
